item.title: Michael add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "Her last conscious thought was disgust at life; her senses had lied to her. The world was not made of energy and delight but of foulness, betrayal, and lassitude. Living was hateful, and death was no better, and from end to end of the universe this was the first and last and only truth." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Michael add a quote by chris onstad
item.description: "If you think about it even medium-hard, launching a scared little dog into space with no intention of getting it back is a seriously fucked thing to do." -- chris onstad

item.title: Michael add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "Actually there were many officers' clubs that Yossarian had not helped build, but he was proudest of the one on Pianosa. It was a sturdy and complex monument to his powers of determination. Yossarian never went there to help until it was finished; then he went there often, so pleased was he with the large , fine, rambling shingled building. It was a truly splendid building, and Yossarian throbbed with a mighty sense of accomplishment each time he gazed at it and reflected that none of the work that had gone into it was his." -- Joseph Heller

item.title: Michael add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "Man was matter, that was Snowden's secret. Drop him out a window, and he'll fall. Set fire to him and he'll burn. Bury him and he'll rot, like other kinds of garbage. The spirit gone, man is garbage. That was Snowden's secret. Ripeness was all." -- Joseph Heller
